intro: Halenia weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's halenia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lanceolate and often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Halenia weberbaueri is noted for its striking blue or violet flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer.
